citations.narrative:
There is no documentation maintained to indicate that an annual review of the contingency plan has been completed.
The contingency plan must be reviewed by the facility on at least an annual basis to ensure that it adequately addresses
all required contingency related criteria and that no updates or changes need to be made to the plan such as changes
made as a result of any recent unforeseen circumstances.
The facility must maintain documentation of their contingency plan annual reviews including documenting any
amendments or changes made since the previous year's review. Correct by Jan. 7, 2025.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
No written environment enhancement plan was available for the birds. All birds inspected were provided with both social
and environmental enrichment.
All facilities must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for
environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by the
attending veterinarian and must be in accordance with the regulations and with currently accepted professional standards
as cited in appropriate professional journals or reference guides.
The facility shall make and keep a written environment enhancement plan that is approved by the attending veterinarian
for the bird species maintained. Correct by Jan. 7, 2025.
This inspection was conducted with the facility representative and exit interview was conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.134(b) 
   
Contingency planning. 
There is no documentation maintained to indicate that an annual review of the contingency plan has been completed.  
The contingency plan must be reviewed by the facility on at least an annual basis to ensure that it adequately addresses 
all required contingency related criteria and that no updates or changes need to be made to the plan such as changes 
made as a result of any recent unforeseen circumstances.  
The facility must maintain documentation of their contingency plan annual reviews including documenting any 
amendments or changes made since the previous year's review. Correct by Jan. 7, 2025. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
No written environment enhancement plan was available for the birds. All birds inspected were provided with both social 
and environmental enrichment.  
All facilities must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for  
environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by the 
attending veterinarian and must be in accordance with the regulations and with currently accepted professional standards 
as cited in appropriate professional journals or reference guides. 
The facility shall make and keep a written environment enhancement plan that is approved by the attending veterinarian 
for the bird species maintained. Correct by Jan. 7, 2025. 
 
This inspection was conducted with the facility representative and exit interview was conducted with the licensee.
